tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
There is nothing boring than waiting for an opportunity!

Are you a genius who longs to build a Robot that could not just solve cliched problem statements, but could accompany you in a quest?

Here comes Tanker Bot, the semi-autonomous robotics event of k!16 which brings a chance to exhibit your innovation and creativity. Give birth to a Metal companion who could discover the road to success and reach victory by knocking down your enemies!

tabs.title: Problem Statement
tabs.content:
» The participants should build a bot capable of performing the following tasks:

1. Autonomous part: The bot should be able to trace a black line on a white background.

2. Manual part: The bot should be able to shoot balls of specified diameter on specified targets. The shooting mechanism should be designed in such a way that it cover an angle of 360 degree.

» Round 1: Design evaluation (all teams will take part).

» Round 2: Prove the autonomous ability of your bot by following the given track to reach the end zone. 

» Round 3: The bot should autonomously traverse a given track to enter the shooting zone, where it should knock down targets using a shooting mechanism controlled by the participant.

» Round 4: The bot should autonomously traverse a given track and stop at target stations for a specified duration. In this time, the bot should knock down targets using a shooting mechanism controlled by the participant. This round will be a knock out.

Note: The target stations and shooting zones will be in such a way that they can be distinguished from the track line.

 

Registration:

The participants are requested to mail the following details of the team members to semiautonomous@kurukshetra.org.in

» Name of the participants

» Name of the institution

» Year and branch of study

» k! IDs (Register online and find this in your profile)

» E-mail address

» Contact number

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» A team can comprise of 4 participants maximum.

» The members of the team can be from different colleges/institutions.

» School students are also welcome for this event.

» The students should have their institution ID along with their k! ID.

» The decision of the judge is final and binding.

» Any changes can be made to the bot in between the rounds.

» Usage of A.C. supply is not allowed.

» The usage of Hydraulic and Pneumatic drives is not allowed.

» The bot dimensions must be within 30x30x40cm(length x breadth x height).

» The control of the shooting mechanism can be wired or wireless. In case of wireless control the participant should bring two different frequencies.

» The diameter of the ball to be shot will vary from 30 to 40mm.

» The control of the shooting mechanism can be wired or wireless.

We hope to conduct a healthy competition among the Engineers of future and hence quarrel among the contestants is detested. The penalty might go up to elimination in worst cases.

tabs.title: Track
tabs.content:
ROUND 2

The track will consist of a black line with loops, discontinuities, sharp turns and other testing elements on a white background as shown below:

ROUND 3: Shooting Zone

This round will consist of a track similar to the previous round but will lead to a shooting zone shown below:

ROUND 4

The track will be similar to the previous rounds but with an exception that the shooting zones will

be at placed at multiple locations throughout the track.

NOTE

» All the squares shown above will be of the size 5x5 cm.

» The targets will be placed at a height of 15 cm from the ground.

» The height of the targets will vary from 20 to 30 cm.

» The thickness of the black line will vary from 1.5 to 3 cm.

» The number of targets will not exceed 6.

» The angular spacing between the targets in the shooting zone will vary.

» The shooting mechanism should be designed considering the dimensions of the shooting zone.

» The shooting zone may not be always present along the line of travel of the bot. It can be present

on either of its sides.

» The above images are only sample
